page.title: 06West Buckland Village
page.content: The Church is in the middle of the village it is a 14th century Church but it has a 13th century tower because the rest of the Church was rebuilt after a fire. Bay Cottage or as it used to be called Bay House was the local policemans house.It has small rooms which were used to lock up felons for the night.The rooms have been turned into utility rooms,washing room,larder and cupboards. The village is gradually being modernised some council houses have been built and an old yard which had animal sheds in it,is being torn down and converted into eight houses with garages.The village is very isolated and the people there have to go to Barnstaple for shopping. J.Busek
